title: ISic004390. Fragmentary early Christian funerary inscription
body:
Facsimile Images

a
[---τ]ό παιδὶον
[ὃς ἀπὲθανε] τῇ πρό ε
[εἰδῶν Σεπτε]μβρὶων
[ζῆσας ἔτη---]
b
φα[---]

Apparatus criticus

Text of Tréziny 2011; Tréziny: alternatively φλ

English translation

[name] ... the infant, who died on the fifth day before the Ides(?) of September, having lived...

commentary

The restorations are to some extent exempli gratia, since e.g. the Kalends is possible instead of the Ides, and October and November are also possible restorations for the month. It is not clear where the second fragment fits in (the letters are smaller, but the marble is the same). Although Tréziny suggest lambda is also possible, from the photograph alpha looks reasonably certain. As Tréziny notes, there appears to be a vacat after the second letter.

bibliography

  • Tréziny 2011 127-129 with fig.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002619
  • Tréziny 2018 283-284 with fig.422 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002599
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
